definitions.definition: A situation, by legal privilege or other agreement, in which solely one party ( company , cartel etc.) exclusively provides a particular product or service , dominating that market and generally exerting powerful control over it.
An exclusive control over the trade or production of a commodity or service through exclusive possession .
examples: A land monopoly renders its holder(s) nearly almighty in an agricultural society.

definitions.definition: The privilege granting the exclusive right to exert such control.
examples: Granting monopolies in concession constitutes a market-conform alternative to taxation for the state, while the crown sometimes bestowed a monopoly as an outrageous gift.

definitions.definition: The holder (person, company or other) of such market domination in one of the above manners.

main_definition: A situation, by legal privilege or other agreement, in which solely one party ( company , cartel etc.) exclusively provides a particular product or service , dominating that market and generally exerting powerful control over it.
secondary_definitions: An exclusive control over the trade or production of a commodity or service through exclusive possession .
The privilege granting the exclusive right to exert such control.
( metonymic ) The holder (person, company or other) of such market domination in one of the above manners.
